Description: Fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery closed vessel; slipped white (10 YR 8/2.5) on the exterior. A lion (?) to right, its mane incised; added white applied over the black for details at the ribs(?).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The added white at the ribs is unusual (see also the stylistically unrelated Alexandria 9474).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 59, no. 216 pl. 50)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.924)
